title: Manhole fires on Newbury Street prompt building and street evacuations
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Six manholes exploded on Newbury Street, leading to evacuations and street closures, Boston Fire Department reported.
Evacuations occurred from Gloucester Street to Dartmouth Street and involved four buildings, according to fire officials.
No injuries were reported; the fires may have been caused by an electrical issue, according to WCVB.

title: South Station’s new fare gates still out of service more than a week after snow storm
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: South Station fare gates were shut down after a January snowstorm brought 16-23 inches of snow to Boston.
Installed in December, the 40 fare gates cost $1.3 million and an additional $2 million for installation.
MBTA, Keolis, and Scheidt & Bachmann are working to restore the gates, which remain closed as of February 2.

title: Devin McCourty on ’25 Patriots: ‘A lot different than us’
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Devin McCourty praises the 2025 Patriots' mentality and identifies differences from past championship teams led by Tom Brady.
Mike Vrabel emphasizes a new team identity, downplaying past Patriots' dynasties as they pursue a seventh Lombardi Trophy.
Drake Maye emerges as an MVP candidate, while a revamped Patriots roster and coaching style aim for Super Bowl success.

title: Woman who posed as student at Boston high schools accepts plea deal, sentenced to probation
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Shelby Hewitt, 34, of Canton, pleaded guilty to five charges related to posing as a student in Boston schools.
Hewitt was sentenced to four years of probation, ordered to pay over $9,000 in restitution, and barred from schools.
She attended three high schools claiming false identities, using forged documents and posing as a DCF social worker.

title: BPS pauses new hiring amid deficit as district predicts hundreds of layoffs next year
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Boston Public Schools implements a partial hiring freeze amid a projected $53 million budget deficit this fiscal year.
Three Boston schools will close by 2027, potentially impacting 300 to 400 teacher and paraprofessional jobs.
Health insurance, transportation, and other rising costs are contributing factors to the school district's current budget deficit.

title: From SNL-style ‘Weekend Updates’ to a TD Garden beer chug, Will Campbell isn’t afraid to bring the laughs
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Will Campbell performs SNL-style 'Weekend Update' for Patriots, providing humor in Friday meetings under Mike Vrabel's direction.
Campbell's humor extended to a viral beer chugging incident at a Celtics game, earning him recognition for humorous antics.
Despite injury setbacks, Campbell improved the Patriots' offensive line, praised by Pro Football Focus for raising the line's potential.

title: Police searching for Dorchester girl missing since Thursday
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Boston police are searching for Mela Rosario, 17, who went missing from her Dorchester home on January 29 around 11 p.m.
Rosario was last seen near Brockton courthouse after a family court appearance; last contacted family at 11:30 a.m. on the same day.
She is 5’1” with brown skin, brown eyes, and was wearing a pink jacket, black leggings, and brown Ugg boots.

title: Devin McCourty explains ‘travesty’ following Belichick, Kraft Hall-of-Fame snubs
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bill Belichick and Robert Kraft were not selected for the Pro Football Hall of Fame's Class of 2026.
Devin McCourty criticized the Hall of Fame voting process, expressing confusion over Belichick and Kraft's omission.
McCourty believes the omission could overshadow the Hall of Fame induction ceremony later this year.

title: Celtics reportedly trade Anfernee Simons to Bulls, acquire Nikola Vučević
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Celtics traded guard Anfernee Simons and a second-round pick to Chicago Bulls for center Nikola Vučević and a second-round pick.
The trade decreases Boston's luxury-tax penalty from $39.5 million to $17.7 million, bringing them under the NBA's first apron.
Vučević, 35, averages 16.9 points and 9.0 rebounds, enhancing Celtics' frontcourt dominated by Neemias Queta and Luka Garza.

title: What Mike Vrabel said of Robert Kraft’s latest snub from Pro Football Hall of Fame
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Robert Kraft will not be part of the Pro Football Hall of Fame Class of 2026.
Patriots coach Mike Vrabel expressed disappointment but confidence that Kraft will eventually be recognized.
Kraft has been Patriots owner for 32 years, achieving six Super Bowl wins and 20 division titles.
